description:
VEGETARIAN REVIEW

wow! i'm so lucky to have an awesome mexican spot so close to me! 

i ordered the super veggie burrito w/ pinto beans and it has broccoli, zucchini and bell peppers! it was quite good. i really like the red spicy salsa they have. 

nice little mexican tucked away on cortland st. :]
author: Shruti D.

description:
Deeelicious!

Had a torta with al pastor and woman had veggie burrito. Both excellent.

Salsas on point, service with a smile, chips fresh n crunchy. Prices reasonable, and I'm a cheapskate.

Gotta try it if you're in the mood for a peaceful good Mexican meal.
author: Auza A.

description: My Go-To authentic taco place in the neighborhood. Food is great, made to order, and the staff are friendly. Nice to sit outside if you have the opportunity to do so, as it is in the heart of Downtown Bernal Heights.
author: David D.

description:
Super Friendly service and good food at this little neighborhood spot...the salsa was really good, the Lengua en Salsa was tender and delicious, and the corn tortillas were thick and perfectly soft. They also have margaritas and sangria on the menu which is a plus. 
A perfect spot for a mid week Mexican craving. 
I'd definitely come back here.
author: Nilu r.

description: Ok, this is my favorite restaurant on Cortland. Delicious food (especially the Burrito Mojado). The portions are a good size and the price is just right. The servers are friendly, the restaurant is clean and the overall experience is great. I've only been here about 5x but have never been disappointed.
author: JonJon W.

description:
Los Altos is my family's favorite spot for a great meal and friendly service. The staff is so kind to my kids. My boys know that at Los Altos they'll always get a friendly smile when we arrive and a sweet lollipop when we go!

Oh yeah, and the food... Wonderful! My favorite is the fajitas with homemade tortillas. Enjoy!
author: Laurie D.

description: Love love love this place all of their food is authentic and healthy not so easy to achieve with Mexican food. Prices are reasonable service is good. Place is catching on and can be busy on weekend evenings. Closed Sunday
author: Maria R.

description:
They have the best veggie tacos and best nachos in town! 
Chips and salsa is $1.50 but is totally worth it because everything is made there. Remember nobody likes a freeloading asshole so don't go in there thinking you can get away with being rude and make comments like " mission street is cheaper" 
Yeah also McDonald's fake as food. So if you stop by make sure you ready to eat bomb as food made with love. 
They also have specials Tuesdays that are bomb
author: Edith M.

description: This is an amazing restaurant with the most amazing staff, veggie burrito (with chicken), Agua Fresca (all flavors), and most of all the tacos!  This is my family's go to restaurant for great tasting Mexican food.
author: Kat M.

description: It's not the best Mexican I've ever had, but its pretty great.  Tried a burrito with the tinga (chicken) for the first time today and it was real tasty.  Great for a local spot.
author: Nick B.

description: veggie tacos are the bomb!!!! yummiest tacos and they have a noel special torta but if you call it the Bri special, they will know its the same. Gisela is the little one, she's great though and I like Londs too. When they make the cucumber water, its the best!!
author: Bri T.

description:
It's mediocre at best. I live nearby and wish so badly it was at least a little better. But...no.

They are super nice/kind/helpful/etc.

Foods no good though.
author: Dan K.

description: Ordered the green enchiladas with shredded chicken and a hot chocolate. The owners are Mexican and offer great friendly service! The hot chocolate is Abuelita hot chocolate and the enchiladas were delicious. Can't wait to come again!
author: Veronica G.

description:
I have one word for you: TINGA

TINGA is the chipotle marinated beef. I have only had it here. I dream about it. Other than the tinga meat this place is very standard. 

5 stars for tinga. Srsly.
author: gabriella m.

description: This place is pretty great. Hand-made corn tortillas, and great veggie burritos with grilled vegetables.  The carnitas is also very good here.
author: Daniel W.

description: Good authentic Mexican food. We especially liked the rice and beans and their horchata. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.
author: Sam D.

description: I he the Super Tacos and they were delicious and plenty of food for lunch. Very good authentic Mexican food at a good price. Service is very friendly and the premises clean. Very nice experience.
author: Scott S.

description: Refried beans were smoky and creamy and tasted full of bacon fat - yum.  Margarita was a bit flavorless but gave me a good buzz.  Chips and salsa were very fresh and flavorful but should be free with the meal.  The beef tinga was tasty but could have been better.  The cheese enchiladas were just okay.  They were not very hot and the sauce tasted like pure tomato paste with not enough heat or spice to my liking.  Overall a great lunch and will absolutely be back to try more items on the menu.  Service was top notch and enjoyed the ambiance from start to finish.  Extra props to the chefs for offering hefty portions, fresh habanero salsa and crisp vegetable garnish on every plate.  I look forward to going back soon!  I can't believe I have lived near here for this long and never popped in to this fine establishment that is clearly an institution of classic Mexican for locals and visitors from all walks of life.  Don't judge a book by it's cover.  Some of the best restaurants in San Francisco You would never know by looking at the façade.  Cheers!
author: A H.

description:
We popped in for a late lunch and enjoyed decent tacos, good service, and a casual setting.

The tacos taste reasonably good, are a good size, and are well-priced.  We would have preferred more salsa on the tacos, however - they were a bit dry.  Also, when asked if we wanted chips and salsa, we didn't realize there was an additional charge - we expected them to be complimentary, like many Mexican restaurants.

The service was friendly and our food came out fast, which we appreciated!

The restaurant is simple, casual, and clean.

Overall, a pleasant, "homey" spot for a quick, inexpensive meal.
author: Barnali D.

description: This place used to serve passable Mexican food. But lately they have gone way downhill. They have raised their prices for one - they now charge for fresh tortillas. The food is mostly flavorless, they don't use nearly enough salt in anything and the salsa verde isn't the least bit sour. But the worst part was finding a hunk of beef in my veggie enchiladas and an eggshell in my huevos. Appalling.
author: Rebecca A.

description: 5 stars bc their nachos are probably one of the best I've tried tbh. The chips never get soggy!!!!! I'm very passionate about not having soggy chips. Chicken tinga is ace. And it's nice and calm to sit inside.
author: Cecilia H.

description: Amazing vege burritos -- best I've ever had. Really great casual place with good prices.
author: James K.

description: Staff was friendly and attentive. Great atmosphere, with Diego Rivera paintings around the space that give you a sense as if you're back at your abuelita's house. Not to mention the lively jams, along with the bomb ceviche kept my taste buds movin' and groovin'.
author: Denise M.

description:
The service was so bad here that I left. My three year old screamed as we walked away because she wanted tacos so badly. But I preferred suffering though that than to deal another second with the poor service here.

Right when I walked in I knew that this place was going to be a disaster. It wasn't clear whether we were suppose to sit down or order at the counter. After a couple minutes of just standing there I saw another customer walking to their table with menus in hand. That was my hint to just grab an empty table. I looked around to see where that customer got the menus but I couldn't figure it out. It's at that point a couple staff members came out and started taking orders at other tables.

I sat there and waited patiently. And waited. And waited. No menus. No acknowledgement. Not even a glance.

I finally just walked out.

It was pretty clear the place was understaffed. I feel sorry for the workers because it's clear the owners don't care.
author: Ali A.

description: Food is pretty good but I would say a bit expensive including the half order of nachos which you are better off ordering a whole order for the price difference and in what you get. I guess it's probably because of the area of San Francisco. The mushroom quesadilla is not worth it...but I love the aqua frescas! Large cups are not really that big; more like a medium.
author: Ashley H.

description: Me encanta la comida de Los Altos! We have been eating there every once in a while for over a decade. Our favorites are shrimp burrito with refried beans, the giagantic tostadas and baby burrito for the kids. Their aguas are so good, too. The service is friendly and polite. No complains at all. Gracias! :D
author: Katy E.

description:
Great Mexican food! I had a chicken burrito which was delicious. Want it a bit spicier, sure, here's a bottle of fresh habanero sauce to help with that. 

Very reasonably priced and delicious is how I would sum this place up!
author: Mike T.

description: Come on Bernal Heights! Your burritos should be better than having 3 day old rice and tasteless carne asada! This burrito tasted like the very mediocre (non?)cousin of even the worst burrito on 24th street. One star for the ambiance, it felt like a local nice joint.
author: Cambridge Y.

description: This place definitely doesn't get enough credit. The food is alway delicious, everyone who works their is super friendly and it's family owned. Every single burrito is bomb
author: Andrew L.

description: Love this place! Been coming here for years, and the food is AMAZING. I always recommend this place to anyone who wants authentic and good quality Mexican food in the city. The customer service is always great.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Me and my partner have been on sort of a half intentional Nacho Quest for the last couple months and probably have had Super Nachos more then a half dozen times.  We researched blogs, Yelp. and city periodicals for the best Nachos in town.
This place has, so far, been the best.  All aspects of the Nachos were perfect.
The quality and flavor of the meat was awesome; very tender with no gristle.  The house made tortilla chips were thick and resistant to sogging, even at the bottom of the plate,  Perfect amount of cheese and toppings (we asked for extra cilantro).  I'm holding back a star simply because this was my first time and I've only had the nachos, but if they are a sign of the rest of the menu, this place is a 5!
author: John W.

description: Some of the best Mexican in SF! Friendly staff, simple atmosphere & amazing food. I come here a few times a week, over the past 10 years and have always loved the food.
author: Alia K.

description:
Started feeling hungry while walking down here earlier today. This is when the decision to come in and get something to eat arise.

The restaurant is spacious and quite accommodating, there are 8 seats outside and the rest are inside. I ordered the Quesadilla Suiza with Chicken - delicious. It wasn't very busy when I came in, being able to immediately order food and getting a seat is a plus. The lady who took my order was nice and friendly.

I am craving for burritos and enchiladas as I write this review. It is adjacent to a coffee shop - definitely of convenience. Also, this taqueria is a short walk from the library.

It is so nice to have a taqueria situated at this spot. Wonderful spot to visit for that hunger satisfaction.

Clean facility and this is something that invited me in here today. Positive first time experience so I'll be back.

Hours of Operation:
Monday - Saturday 10:00 am - 9:30 pm
Sunday 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm
author: Bennett W.

description: This is an exact mom & pop shop of El Torito! Nice n clean but since they have servers, tipping is where they get money. If I'm studying in a cafe or the SFPL nearby I will come here. Yet, this place is a tiny bit more pricy than La Corneta in Glen Park. Either way, I go there to nourish myself before reviewing.
author: R C.

description:
Approved! Had a regular bean taco salad and fish taco as a snack on a Saturday afternoon with the husband. Was the perfect light meal.

Nice seating outside, albeit limited, and lots of seating inside. Will be back!
author: Barbra I.

description: Bad customer service. Ordered the wrong thing because their menu was very confusing and they tried to make me eat it saying "next time order it right". I had to push them to fix my meal free of charge. Customer is always right didn't seem to apply here.
author: Dorth R.

description: I loved the Chile Relleno burrito I had last night.  My boyfriend enjoyed his veggie burrito.  It had a delicious flavor of fresh veggies.   We enjoyed our dinner and coming back again and again.  I love the neighborhood feel as well
author: Amor L.

description: I must have ordered the wrong menu items. Order two chicken items, one mole and one that was cooked in some sort of tomato sauce. The chicken was rough and dry. The mole sauce was bland compared to other mole I've had.
author: Long C.

description: One of my favorite places to eat when I come down to San Francisco, great food but most importantly they make me feel at home and I strongly recommend it.
author: Placido U.

description:
Well this is the only Mexican place on my block.
I think it's nice and cozy in the place and the food is alright and all.Its just they charge for chips.
It's priced reasonably and the food is Ok.
The burritos are good but the pepper that they put in it I hate.Otherwise burritos are good,the tacos are amazing and they are a must.
This is the place if you want to have a quick Mexican meal that's kinda cheap and has good tacos and burritos!
author: Bob L.

description: I love this place, the staff is very friendly and the food is great. I only have it 4 stars because a lot of times when I've gotten take out they have messed up my order, but I still love going here and it's worth it.
author: Sarah P.

description:
I don't know what took me so long to try this place since I drive by it quite often, living in Bernal Heights.  It is truly a hiden Mexican gem on Cortland.

I ordered (to go) Huevos Rancheros and it was DELICIOUS.  The restaurant itself is very cute, and clean. The staff is extremely friendly. They really have quite a menu.

I will definately be back. Highly recommend!

And parking seemed pretty easy.
author: Janet T.

description:
Ugh, this place is just not good quality.

I decided to try it again after seeing some more recent positive reviews, but my first bite of al pastor taco and second bite of chicken quesadilla had hard gristle or bone bits that forced me to spit out the whole mouthful.

I finally picked all the gross chicken off the quesadilla and it was so bland, I couldn't finish. I got my food to go and they didn't offer me either chips or salsa (and there doesn't appear to be a self-service salsa bar, wha?), so nothing could save or mask the sweat sock flavor of this food.

The green sauce on top of the al pastor taco and the tortillas themselves were bright spots, so maybe a veggie or breakfast dish would be an ok way to go. But I don't think I'll ever know, because I'll probably never go back. Those successive gristle bites will haunt me for weeks.
author: Teresa A.

description: The food is ok, if you're willing to walk a bit off the hill into the mission, it's definitely worth it. The people are always friendly and the food comes out fast, plus the decor is nice, but I prefer other places (I just come here for convenience).
author: Bianca E.

description: This is my neighborhood taqueria.  This is a family business and it shows.  Everyone is always very welcoming and nice.  I really like their burritos and their or in chile verde.  They're my go to spot when I don't feel like cooking.  Check them out!
author: Cat M.

description:
TACO!
Gotta love coming here, the place is a cute nifty spot, and the food is great.
I ate anything from taco to the ceviche. 
I definitely recommend eating here.
author: Kevin M.

description: Came here for dinner the other night on a Thursday.  It wasn't busy when we walked in so we got a table right away.  Waitress was friendly and service was good.  I had the fish taco and the carnitas taco - both were tasty, not the best I've had but tasty.  My husband had a burrito which he enjoyed.  I wouldn't go out of my way to try it, but if in the neighborhood, it's good.
author: Sarah F.

description: Absolutely delicious. Chicken fajitas = awesome. Chile Verde = awesome. Best rice. Good!!! Service fast and friendly also.
author: TheOne L.

description: Best Mexican food! Awesome service, family friendly restaurant and flavorful, tasty, delicious dishes.
author: Anya d.

description: I don't care what y'all think: the mushroom quesadilla is awesome and goes great with a glass of sangria.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Very average Mexican food.  I got two tacos one al pastor the other carne asada.  They were really under seasoned.  My wife got the carne asado which was also very bland.  My fault for getting Mexican food outside the mission :/
author: P N.

description:
It really disgusts me that the only reason people go here is because they're too scared to go to the mission for some real Mexican food. If you can't even walk two blocks to eat at a sub-par Mexican food place, it just shows how gentrified Bernal has become.

This place shouldn't even be considered a Mexican food restaurant. This is a place that serves rice and beans (disgusting ones, might I add) ...and the meat.. is it meat? or cat food?.. Dog food? Who knows, but its not carne asada! 

This place is gross and every time I walk past this place I rack my head, over and over, and try and fine a reason why there's people inside! What is wrong with people these days?..

People of Bernal Heights, let's ban together and boycott this horrible, so called Mexican food joint, and get a REAL Mexican food place on Cortland!!
author: Jessie A.

description:
A real gem in Bernal Heights. The breakfast burrito is my favorite and the salsas are great (the hot can be hotter though).

Menudo is amazing too, make sure you put mayonnaise on it!!!

Service is good; they can be slow sometimes. If you're in a hurry call in your order. Wish their hours were longer too.
author: Thomas G.

description: I really wanted to like this place because it's close to where I live...the truth is this place is not very good.  I mean with the mission a few blocks away any other taqueria there would crush this place.  I'm really not sure who is reviewing this place and how they could give that good of a rating if you've eaten at any other taqueria in the area...
author: christopher h.

description: This place is amaZing, best place in the city. If you're a vegetarian and tired of getting low grade Mexican burritos you need to make this a stop! Veggies taste so damn good! Staff is always nice, prices are good, place is clean +cute! Love it! XVida. I bring all my friends here :)
author: Tegan C.

description:
Good food, overall.  Don't like that you have to pay for chips + salsa. 

Veggie burrito is great, too.
author: David G.

description:
At every organization, there is a designated person that takes care of the meeting accommodations and catering events however, that position is up for grabs so I have been volunteering to do that - since I love food and an obsessed Yelpette.  I can't help that I cannot live w/o Yelp; Yelp is a way of life, a necessity... but today's luncheon choice wasn't coordinated by me because I have been busy and cost was a factor but that did not mean the selected wasn't great.

My director have mentioned this taco place for awhile now and I'm glad one of the supervisors set this up for the luncheon.  Although this isn't so Christmas-y but it is nice to have the company you work for appreciate you by buying you lunch.  

There is one guy working the grill.  He comes early to set everything up: the salsa bar, the chips, the salad, and the bazillion bags of flour tortilla awaits the hungry.  There was also refried beans and rice.  You get a choice of meats: pollo, carne asada, and carnitas.  You can pick either a taco or a quesadilla.  I don't pig out when I'm not the one paying for it plus I think it's rather rude to pile your plate so I grabbed a little bit of salad, a small handful of tortilla chips, and a chicken quesadilla.  All orders took about 1-2 minutes, BTW.  The meats were all cooked, it was just heating the flour tortillas that took a brief moment.  My plate was not full compared to my coworkers... they were ordering 6 tacos and a quesadilla.  A lot of them went back for seconds and grabbed me to go so I caved but no tortillas on my second round: all protein but the sour cream was a deadly choice but I just have to have it.  

The carne asada was flavorful and tender but the chicken although flavorful and tender but was a little tough to chew (not chewy).  I just can't explain it.  My chicken quesadilla was fine, it was my second plate that had the tough chicken.  Chicken was bursting w/ flavor.. I can taste the cumin!

I feel like garbage now though.  I had 2 slices of pizza and a garlic breadstick dipped w/ ranch this morning so do you know what this means?  Probably no dinner for me, no Twinkies when I get home, and I will need to burn 1,200 calories tomorrow at the gym.  

Note to self: do the usual workout w/ the addition of Insanity.

Oi vey.. my diet ALWAYS start tomorrow.

Oh God.. I shouldn't have eaten the pizza.  

Damn.. I shouldn't have grabbed a 2nd plate.
author: Tram N.

description: They are our neighborhood go to place for fresh Mexican food. I am addicted to their chile verde.  I enjoy their burritos, and the taco salads are generous, fresh and tasty.  Also, they make their own chips which are delicious with the pico de gallo salsa they serve. The staff is very kind and friendly.
author: Sheila W.

description: Can't say enough good things about this place. I come here for the super shrimp burrito. It's never let me down and keeps me oh so happy. Thank you for being my neighborhood joint.
author: Rachel T.

description:
1st bite, not salty unlike La Corneta
2nd bite, not greasy unlike El Farolito
3rd bite, not watery 
4th bite, enough salsa
5th bite, 6th bite, .... ooops, I finish the baby burrito.
OMG, the last time I finish a burrito is like 10 years ago. 
Price? much cheaper than el Papalote
author: Spike P.

description:
I am sorry but if you can't make a vegetarian torta you are out. Rice taste americanized and guacamole has too much lemon. 

Pay attention to your products please.
author: Michelle P.

description: I have been there three times now. Love this place, love the food.  Twice I got the shrimp tostadas.  Generous amounts of shrimp. Grilled veggies on this salad delish.  Homemade tortias were hot and fresh.  Have been there with my besties and we all agree that this is our favorite mexican restaurant.  Oh, and the service was very good also.
author: Charlene O.

description:
Can you say "Fresh"?

I was pleasantly surprised to be invited to dine at this restaurant last Sunday evening and even more pleasantly surprised when my fish tacos turned out to be BOMB! (and I say that in capitals because they are that good.) Let me list the reasons you should travel to Bernal Heights every time you crave Mexican food.

1. They make their own fresh corn tortillas.
You haven't had real Mexican food till someone makes you a taco with a tortilla they made from scratch.

2. They do not over cook the vegetables. 
This is INSANELY important! So many Mexican restaurants cook their veggies in batches and let it sit in the cooker while it waits to be served so by the time it gets eaten 90% of vitamins, food value, chi, taste, are all but gone!

3. They are fast! 
My meal was ready in less than 10 minutes! 

4. This place has an excellent vibe! 
Its mellow, CLEAN, the waitresses are nice, nice art work on the walls, outdoor seating and its a generally good neighborhood with available parking.

So do yourself a favor, and please, treat yourself to the best Tacos north of the boarder.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I don't hang out in Bernal much, but I accompanied my friends there to see a rental today. They decided to buy me a taco in order to compensate me for my moral support (because a lot of moral support is needed when apartment hunting in this town, as we all know). We went in because a guy outside on the sidewalk said "awesome fish tacos!!!" - that was all the convincing I needed. 

The said fish taco - ordered "super" for $4.95 total - was a grilled style fish taco - not beer battered. It was pretty a-okay, but you could get a similar one in the mission for about a dollar less. just saying. the fish WAS really good though - it was perfectly cooked and seemed like a fairly high quality cut of white fish. It also came with grilled mushrooms and peppers, a nice touch. 

What really annoyed me was that chips and salsa were NOT complimentary. C'mon now, folks.
author: Shannon R.

description: First time I ever sent back food was here. I ordered a chorizo breakfast burrito and asked them to go easy on the chorizo. The burrito was essentially all chorizo and came with almost no egg. I also ordered in Spanish, so this could not have been a miscommunication. We ordered/paid at the front desk, and ended up having to wait until our food came out to just get water, chips & salsa. They employees are nice, but we didn't really get any service. My boyfriend's carne asada burrito was also not good. We should've listened to the bad reviews because it was not a good lunch.
author: Sofia M.

description: Very friendly staff, ambiance fine, food was OK tasty.  Got some super chicken burritos take out last night for the family which were pretty good- not outstanding but certainly more than adequate.  But I have to deduct two stars since everyone got bits of bone and gristle which is fairly off-putting.  One of us just stopped eating.
author: Boris L.

description: Best. Nachos. Ever. I love their nachos with steak and habanero sauce. Their tacos are just as yummy. Getting hungry, yet? I love that it's right up the street. Easy and convenient. Friendly staff. Happy tummies. Love.
author: Mel P.

description:
I had a super burrito and it was good!!
And the server was very kind, she made us feel welcomed. :)
author: Rana K.

description: I think it's good Mexican food. Could be better but in my opinion, it's surprisingly hard to find excelente food in San Francisco so it's good for San Francisco Mexican food
author: Samuel B.

description: Awesome grilled mahi mahi tacos. Fresh fish, grilled veggies, avocado salsa. Simple but delicious
author: Juan R.

description:
I am reviewing Tacos los Altos based on their catering. I first came across their foo at my friends son's birthday party, it was amazing. The taquero serves tacos, tortas and quesadillas. They also set up a nacho bar with various salsas and guacamole. One nice touch is the agua frescas that you can have them serve.

We knew who to call when looking for a taquero for my son's baptism party. Taco los Altos can work with your budget to make sure that your event is a success. We served almost 100 people and everyone raved about the food. My wifes' family is Mexican and they thought everything was great, my father in law being particularly hard to please when it comes to Mexican food thought it was perfect. Taco los Altos showed up on time, very orderly set up, polite employees and undoubtedly great food. I am a huge fan, wide variety of meats and menu, no doubt I will use them again when we need a taquero. 

Extra star for serving the south bay area. Muchos gracias Taco los Altos.
author: Ralphy J.

description: Recently went to Taco Los Altos a couple of weeks ago and ordered the burrito Mojado. The burrito was not back, the service was good. Could have more options on the menu to choose from... Otherwise a pretty good place to eat.
author: Mel H.

description: My wife, my mom and I ate here for lunch. They had the fish tacos, I had several bites it was more than ok. Truthfully, the fish tacos were somewhat flavorful. I had the steak sandwich/torta is it was good--the meat was thinly sliced and moist.  Our meal with 2 sodas and a 15% tip was only $25. If your expectation is La Taqueria, Papalote, Gordo's or The Little Chihuahua, it's not a fair comparison.
author: Al G.

description:
Excellent place!  I'm always on the look out for good taquiera's and this place certainly doesn't disappoint.  I had a burrito there, it was huge and not too expensive.  Excellent guacamole and salsa with it.

Their entree's are a little pricier, but still tasty.  And their magarita's are pretty solid.  

Not the fanciest place, and there isn't a whole lot of seating, but from the ground up, it feels very cozy and simple with great food.  Big party's may be difficult, but if you're looking for a solid south of the border bite, hit this place up!
author: Vincent-Arthur B.

description: Small place. LOVED the super fish burrito. My favorite food is fish tacos but these burritos are a close second
author: Cami B.

description:
This ain't  gringo wanna-be mexican. I'm just loving this place... cheviche plate, yummy-yup-yup, burritos with fire roasted bell peppers... yup-yummy-yup to carnitas tacos with a squeeze of lime ... yup-yup-yummy-yup!

Love this place!
author: Steve S.

description:
Overall the place is ok, I ordered a Burrito and it was GINORMOUS. However I felt that it was missing a little bit of salt in order to bring out all the flavors. 

I'll probably upstate this review at some point, as this place is close to work, and I like to give people second chances.
author: Lannette G.

description:
My coworker urged me one day last week to have lunch at a taqueria place just so I can order out for her a taco. Strange she was craving for that suddenly.

This was the place I decided to come and try out as a result. It's not too far from work and parking is okay during the day it seems. As usual I ordered my favorite at this type of place, an enchilada plate, and I enjoyed it.  The service ladies were very nice and congenial also.

The one minus here is that there's no complimentary nachos prior to your meal like most places. The sign on the table says it's $1.50. Therefore, I skipped on that.
author: H K.

description: The best service & awesome food.  We were in a hurry to eat. Food came fast even though they were busy!
author: Juvy E.

description: Horrible service, loud TV, mediocre food, and they charge for chips. Ugh.
author: Pamela W.

description: I've been here a couple of times for tacos, which are standard mexican street style.  The pastor and carne asada are both really tasty. Both times I have found the carnitas to be dry and lacking in flavor, so I would recommend avoiding that.
author: Russ P.

description:
I have a thing for Tacos Los Altos. They truly have the best, cheap Sangria in San Francisco. Also the tacos aren't bad. 

There is a secret menu item: avocado green salsa that you have to request, its heaven. Meals under $10, I always order vegetarian here.
author: Shannon Z.

description: Very solid tacos and a fantastic torta. One of my favorite joints in this hood. The salsa is also pretty dang good.
author: Jeff K.

description: There are so many good taquerias in SF. This place is very disappointing. We ate here for dinner. Both the chicken in a taco and the beef in the carnitas were very dry as if they had been under a warning light all day long. I will not return.
author: Douglas S.

description: Five stars only because this is my favorite veggie burrito in San Francisco!! The vegetarian option actually has roasted veggies which is different than most others which consists of beans rice and salsa.
author: Sean A.

description: It is a pretty solid Mexican food place. It isn't as good as some of the places in the mission, but it is really good. I live in bernal and it is much easier than getting to the mission sometimes.
author: Lily C.

description: This place cannot make a good burrito - always dry and flavorless. If you do end up being forced there by friends, i'd go with the fish tacos.
author: seth c.

description:
Great for what it is - a small neighboorhood taco joint.

The service is great - you get chips and salsa even if you take-out! Pretty darned good carne asada tacos here.
author: Scott H.

description: I'm still trying to figure out how to order at this place as it's hit or miss. So far I'm a fan of the  Super Choriza Breakfast Burrito. I suggest losing the lettuce and using black beans. You won't need dinner afterwards, or the belt around your pants for that matter.
author: Shaw V.

description:
Alright, I've got to admit that the food here is pretty good, no Farolito's but still tasty... However the service is AWFUL!!

If you're dinning in be prepared to wait forever to place an order, let alone get food or a check. Togo orders are even worse, I can't tell you how many times I've politely waited at the register to place an order while being ignored by the staff... and forget about placing a phone order! Last time I tried I was left "on hold" for 5 minutes until someone realized the phone was off the hook and that there might be a person on the line :(

Maybe one day the owners/management will deal with the poor service issues, until then be prepared to wait and wait at this restaurant.
author: Rebecca S.

description: The tostada salad with chicken and huevos rancheros are super tasty! We got them to go and service was fast and friendly.
author: Bianca T.

description: Okay I went to Tacos Los Altos with low expectations. I love Mexican food and it's in my neighborhood so I decided to give it a try. I was so pleasantly surprised ! My friend who is Mexican ordered the flautas and I ordered the chile rellenos. Both dishes were very good, the flautas had lots of avocado and they were deliciously crispy. My relleno came with fresh handmade corn tortillas - yum. The rice and refried beans were fresh and tasty. The weak part of the meal was the tortilla chips - we both agreed they were too salty. My friend had the sangria and it was delicious - and not too sweet. The service was prompt and gracious. Definitely will return !
author: Michelle M.

description: this is a local neighborhood mexican favorite in bernal. there's always a table and the staff is very friendly. they've messed up on a few of my to-go orders in the past so i would make sure to check your bag before leaving the restaurant. the food is good.
author: Vicky L.

description:
I ordered Huevos Rancheros for an early dinner. Their breakfast serve all day. The lady got my order and brought me chips and salsa. They will ask if you want hot or mild salsa.

My order came out in about 10 minutes. My dish is kinda weird. I have my eggs and beans but instead of a sauce on top of the eggs, it has some grilled onions and bell peppers. And instead of rice it came with homestyle potato (im not a huevos rancheros expert but does it suppose to come with rice?)

The plus:
The lady is very nice

good tortilla

They serve your food fast


The negatives:
They will be charge 1.00 for chips and salsa. You will just be surprise on your tab!

My huevos is kinda weird. Without the sauce its kinda bland.

Their restroom is only one and its in the front. So people know if you did number  1 or 2!!! So make it QUICK people!!!


Am i going back here, maybe but will NOT order the same dish.
author: roderick s.

description:
This place is a favorite.  Their vegetarian options were the draw to start coming here, but the whole menu is what keeps us coming back...weekly!

Awesome mexican breakfast served all day and the homemade tortillas served with dinner plates are to die for.  I mostly enjoy the pastor and carnitas meats and love getting the made-to-order flautas.  The ceviche is always fresh and delicious and so are the aguas frescas.  Not to mention, the fresh salsa and chips you get when you sit down, this place is the best!

Must try:  Noel's Special Torta

Basic mexican sandwich but it is packed with flavors.  Pastor, carne asada, or bbq chicken topped with onions, cilantro, salsa & avocado salsa on a nice roll.
author: Smiley D.

description: Fantastic little place to get tacos and burritos. Two tacos will fill up the bottom of an entire to-go box. The burritos are massive as well. They do not skimp on the meat portions and the carne asada and chorizo are top notch!
author: Ryan H.

description:
OK, sing along if you please...Bernal Heights is like the Austrian Alps, don't ya think?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V7FV2A4AMYE

High on a hill is a lonely tacqueria
Lay ee odl lay ee odl lay hee hoo
Loud is the voice of the hungry eater
Lay ee odl lay ee odl-oo

Folks in the 'hood that was quite remote heard
Lay ee odl lay ee odl lay hee hoo
Lusty and clear from the taco maker's throat heard
Lay ee odl lay ee odl-oo

After I left the abbey when it became apparent I was becoming a problem for the nuns to solve, I decided to stop at this local neighborhood tacqueria on my way to Captain Von Trapp's palatial house. The thought of taking care of seven incorrigible children made me feel peckish, in particular, since I ran up Cortland singing the Rodgers and Hammerstein songbook over three octaves.

I ordered a weekend special of theirs, the $8.75 Bar-B-Q Pork Chops with Refried Beans and Rice. Frankly, the chops were quite dry, and I would have given them up for Lent had I known the salsa wouldn't cut through it. I heard the veggie burritos are delish, so I must return for those on my way back to the abbey as I contemplate the encroaching Nazis and the Captain's hormonally driven advances toward me. Talk about climbing ev'ry mountain!

Soon my Mama with a gleaming gloat heard
Lay ee odl lay ee odl lay hmm hmm
What a duet for a man and his pork chop
Lay ee odl lay ee odl-oo

FOOD - 3 stars...probably ordered the wrong thing for my virginal visit here...stick with the basics..when will I learn?
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...flies are a-buzzing and the formica is slick
SERVICE - 4 stars...very friendly and proud of their food...no one here is 16 going on 17
TOTAL - 3 stars...passable Mexican food on a hill ...because somewhere in my youth or childhood...I must've done something...something good

Odl lay ee, old lay ee
Odl lay hee hee, odl lay ee
Odl lay odl lay, odl lay odl lee, odl lay odl lee
Odl lay odl lay odl lay
HOO!
author: Ed U.

description:
What I tried:
- carnitas burrito was so-so
- steak burrito was good
- fish quesadilla was nice

But they are slow. At least, at lunch, the time I tried.

I think next time I'll pre-order on the phone before picking up
author: Yann K.

description:
I would never go to Los Altos for tacos, but Tacos Los Altos, I would definitely go again and again.  I love this hole in the wall in Bernal Heights.  

Service is quick and friendly.  If you are going to order one thing on their menu, you gotta get the taco el pastor.  The meat is seasoned close to perfection, so well done,  that every bite is a burst of juices and flavors.  I seem to have tasted garlic, paprika, pepper, but im sure it has tons of other seasonings.   another notable item on the menu is the tinga.  again, the meat is well seasoned and has a rich smoky flavor.   to wash down the meal, we had an awesome agua fresca/canteloupe.  

The one disappointment was the salsa.  though it was fresh, i would have liked some more jalapenos and habaneros in it.   but i'm sorta glad that the salsa was mild so i can appreciate the rich flavorings in their food.
author: Kris H.

description:
It's the relatively reasonable prices combined with the yum chips, salsa and nachos that make me come here week after week. 

They have outdoor seating, which on a sunny day on Courtland is money!
author: Ashley K.

description: This is a small establishment with a distinctly homey feel.  My husband ordered the super chicken taco and I had a fish taco.  Both were loaded to the point that we used our forks before we could handhold the tacos.l. We also split a Caesar salad to go with our lunch.  An extra plate was brought it out for us.  All of our food was very fresh and well-prepared.
author: Danielle S.

description: Just moved into the area and this place is a real find.  The veggie tacos are grilled and very good.  The drinks are pretty yummy too.  We sit outside with our dog and they are always very sweet to her as well.  Not the fanciest place, but very good food every time.
author: Jeni S.

description:
It's cute and the service was good, but my burrito was edible at best.  It was bland...SO bland.  I mean, I used about half a container of hot sauce to make it edible.  Plus, there were pieces of bone and gristle in my chicken that sort of made me want to gag.  I had to throw away about half of it because the chicken was just so unpleasant.

Their hours don't even make them good drunk food.  This is super disappointing considering how close it is.  I don't anticipate coming here again unless I am very hungry and feeling very lazy...and even then, I've bought better pre-made reheatable Mexican food from the Good Life Grocery across the street.  What's more, the mission is just a lazy waddle down the hill from me.
author: PrincessPeac H.

description: Stayed in the neighborhood and wanted to eat nearby. It wasn't bad. Large portions. I would eat here again if we come back to this neighborhood.
author: Mary B.

description: Four stars for the veggie burrito - it has actual vegetables in it (as opposed to mostly rice/beans) and the kids size is just right for me. Everything else I've tried is kinda meh.
author: Sue D.

description: Quality of the meat is really poor. The carne asada is full of chunks of fat, the chicken is mostly dark meat. Not a great burrito.
author: H M.

description: I was craving a burrito and didn't want to climb back up the hill from mission street to the house. So i started wandering around Cortland and found this one and only Mexican place up in Bernal Heights. I ordered the Super Steak Burrito and I PAID $1.50 for chips and salsa (This should be free!) it came out to $10, dang! While walking home I was thinking, this better be a freaking good burrito for that much money!...Fresh whole pieces of avocado, good flavored beef, nice big burrito. Ok it was worth the money and satisfied my craving.
author: Karen T.

description: Not only were they nice and accommodating, the had the BEST TACOS I HAVE EVER EATEN. Veggie taco -- fresh, grilled veggies (even broccoli!) with the perfect amount of cheese and guac. The shrimp taco had the most delicious green salsa, almost pesto-y with a yummy kick to it. SO GOOD! Love this place!
author: Katie B.

description: I rarely give 1 star reviews, but this place sucks. The margaritas are awful, and I'm 2 for 2 on food poisoning. My kids like their cheese quesadillas, but that is so awfully overpriced for cheese between two quesadillas. And the kid's cheese enchilada plate only gives each kid half the quesadilla. Even my 3 year old was asking for more. Who gives this place 5 stars?
author: Jeanie K.

description: Truly a hidden treasure. They have the PERFECT size menudo. This spot is literally down the street from my house and I had no idea.! Very excited to have found it I will definitely be coming back. Service was quick and friendly. and quaint outside seating. I would take friends here that are visiting from out of town or to catch up with a friend.
author: Anita C.

description: Really great burritos! The staff were great, provided a excellent recommendation for my food selection. Throughly enjoyed it!
author: Hari N.

description: We were there on Thursday night.  The pricey of the food considering we're on Cortland Ave was reasonably priced and service was great.  Unfortunately, we weren't impressed by the food.  I didn't think the guacomole $6.00 it was not worth it, it was bland and it didn't look fresh - slight brown color even the fried tortilla shell was stale.  We had the carnitas (not fresh the meat), fish taco (kind of fishy smell - fresh fish has no smell) and we thought it was k.  We tried their fresh made sangria and it wasn't as flavorful.  I don't know if we were there on an off day but it wasn't that great.
author: pengrin ..

description: Very pleasant place to eat. Large portions, reasonably priced. Friendly service. Every time I've gone there a number of local families were also there which I take as a good sign.
author: Bruce T.

description:
So I used to work at Marthas&Bros and used to have their foood all the time and everything is soo delicious. My favorites are the super burrito de Birria, crispy chicken salad and their mole. The service is great and this is an authentic Mexican place a little expensive but is all worth it. I brought some friends and they love it and the aguas frescas delicioso =]
P.S you can make your own burrito they dont tell you that but you can add almost anything
author: Julia D.

description:
Tacos Los Altos is a good local taqueria spot. I love Bernal Heights, so I love their location. It's a small, simple restaurant, but the staff are very friendly and know their customers by name.

Burritos are big and hearty. Tacos, especially the al pastor, is really flavorful. Nachos and quesadillas are kid favorites.  We haven't tried much of anything else from the menu. 

Overall, good place.
author: Joy A.

description:
This is our local Burrito joint and I do so wish it were better.  It's a cute little place, run by cute little people and I would love to give them more business.  As a self-respecting San Franciscan however, I simply can't bring myself to tolerate mediocre burritos more than a few times a year.  It just wouldn't be right.  

They do have a taco salad which is pretty good - as long as you don't fool yourself that salad = low-cal/healthy.  Not when it is served in one of those greasy-crispy shell things and full of sour cream and avocado.

I'm sorry nice counter ladies.  I will think of you as I slink down the hill to Taqueria Cancun.
author: Molly T.

description:
Some outstanding and some disappointing aspects to this little taqueria.

Rants:

The chicken "Chimichanga" was not a chimichanga at all, and half the size it should have been. Yes, I know that the Chimichanga is actually originating from Arizona in the 1950's, but please, a small grilled burrito topped with lettuce, sour cream and guacamole is NOT a chimichanga. A LARGE FRIED item is the only item truly worthy of the name. Tacos Los Altos serves up a true stinker.

The crab enchiladas were not very tasty. 

The "Margaritas" we ordered didn't seem to have any actual liquor in them. The sweet and sour was all that I could taste.

Raves:

The Sangria was okay. Not overly sweet.

The fresh handmade tortillas and the huevos rancheros make this place stand out for me. Really really good for breakfast.

Delicious White pozole is served with lettuce, radish and limes. Que Rico!
author: Kimberley M.

description:
I don't often order burritos anymore, but seeing as how they're a local specialty, I obliged (whom, I couldn't tell you). I took a seat and was quickly brought chips and perfectly good salsa along with my Jarritos, and got to work on those.

I ordered a burrito mojado with carnitas, and was amused to see that it came bandera nacional style -- a stripe of pico de gallo, one of sour cream and one of guacamole. It was definitely tasty. I'm not a veteran of the area (split my time between LA and the Twin Cities), but it seems to me that the mexican food around here is available at a premium of a couple extra bucks. My burrito was satisfying but anything but sensational.

The carnitas had good texture, and the sauce, which was ranchera style, did its job but was uninspired. Then again, i'm not a huge fan of salsa ranchera to begin with. It was large and I was hungry, so at the end of the lunch period I call it a success. I have too many other places in the area to check out before I would come back here, but if you're looking for inexpensive Mexican in Bernal Heights, this is a good spot.
author: Jack P.

description:
The food is really good and really cheap. What more could you ask for? 

Thor ate lunch here one day and liked it so much he wanted to take me, so we went back the next day for dinner. He was really pleased with his food both times, although I can't remember what it was. I was trying to decide between the fish taco and the super fish taco; the waitress recommended the regular and it was great. We also got a side order of mushrooms grilled in garlic butter, and it was likewise great. We ordered a hibiscus drink to share because we weren't sure how it would taste, but it was delicious and refreshing.

We will be back.
author: Rachel G.

description: The beans were clearly from cans, the rice bland, there was way too much lime juice (from a bottle not fresh) in both the salsa and guacamole. Finally, one person got their food, the second person got there's about 4-5 minutes later, finally the third person in our party got their food another 5 minutes later. And the margarita was made from a mix.
author: LH H.

description:
I hate give 2 stars (I'm very sorry) but we just ate burritos and a taco from Los Altos.  Not good.  Very greasy,  the carnitas didn't taste fresh, I could go on, but won't.  
Last resort
author: Rahna B.

description:
I ate here a couple years ago and  decided never to come back.

A friend of mine persuaded me to try it again, and everything was much better: the setting, the service and the food.

Highlights:
Chili relleno = awesome!
Tostada salad = hits the spot -- multiple spots, actually
Habanero salsa (you must ask for it) = whoo hoo!

But what's up with the beans? Why are they soooo bland?
author: Eggy P.

description:
We ordered four burritos to go. Three regular chicken and one breakfast burrito with eggs and chorizo. The chicken burrito eaters declared them "Good". 

As the consumer of the breakfast burrito, it was OK, not great. There was a lot of eggs mixed with the chorizo which was surprisingly mild along with chunks of potato. Another surprise was the addition of salsa to the breakfast burrito. Perhaps I'm being too plebeian, but I didn't like the salsa with my breakfast burrito. 

Would I go back? Yes, if I was in the neighborhood, but wouldn't make a special trip for it.
author: Scott S.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood - on the north side of the hill - and decided to walk over the top of Bernal Hill today. Got here out of breath. Had a steak torta, which kind of reminded me of the cheesesteaks of my home city, except less greasy and with less bread and more mushroom and tomato. Those are all improvements. Good chips too.
author: Michael L.

description:
I'm a sucker for catchy advertising, and when I saw "The Best Mexican Food" it was just too much to pass up.

Well, it wasn't the best Mexican food I've ever had, but it was still definitely a damn good burrito, on par with your typical Mission burrito, although not amazing.

I'm not in this neighborhood too often though, so it's unlikely I'll come back.

I didn't like though how unlike most other taquerias where you pay before your order then you can sit down and they'll bring it to you; you pay at the end so I felt guilt-tripped into leaving a tip after a burrito.

Also thought it was kind of weird they wrapped it up in foil and served it on a plate.
author: Mark A.

description: I must rave about the vegetarian burrito. You know how when you usually order a veggie burrito (and probably non-veggie as well), everything's going great and then, by the end, you're kind of sorry you ate the whole burrito? Well, not so here. And it's because their veggie burritos are filled with - get this - grilled veggies! So yummy! And because it's filled with grilled mushrooms and zucchini and onions, there's less rice and cheese which makes you feel a little worse for wear at the end of the usual burrito. So check this one out and you'll be happy you did.
author: peter R.

description:
Here's what I love most about Tacos Los Altos: their super veggie burritos. I'm consistently disappointed by what Mexican restaurants call a vegetarian burrito. Usually they're nothing more than flavorless beans and rice with a little cheese, salsa and iceberg lettuce thrown in. Even places with great meat based entrees often fail when it comes to a decent vegetarian option.

Tacos Los Altos' super veggie burrito is filled with delicious, tender roasted vegetables, sour cream, and guacamole at no extra charge. Yes, it's a seven dollar burrito, which is sort of wrong, but it's worth it.

Keep in mind, I haven't eaten anything other than the super veggie burrito there, but that alone warrants five stars, seriously.

The place has a cozy atmosphere and is located on the always festive Cortland Ave., a short walk from my house when I need a burrito fix, which is fairly often. The service can be a bit slow, but the people there are really nice, and I'm happy that I have another good veggie burrito option other than Papalote.
author: Jill H.

description: The staff are wonderfully friendly, offering lollipops to kids at the end of the meals ... Yet the food is passable at best.
author: Alexandre P.

description:
It was one of a few places in the area open on a Sunday afternoon. Lucky for us. Two tacos each at Tacos Los Altos is a lot of food for a late lunch when dinnertime is normally between 5 and 6pm. They really pile it on too. The first basket of chips is free. Every subsequent basket is $1, according to the menu. 

Friendly folks. Good service. I love the local businesses.

Someone needs to take a look at their accounting though. Not only did they not charge us for the second basket of yummy crispy chips, but they also messed up on their math with the rest of the bill. We left a nice tip instead.
author: Tinna H.

description:
Nice taqueria on Cortland with really friendly service. I'm not sure if the guy who brought our food to our table got a good look at me, but he started speaking to ME in Spanish. Sitting right across the table from me was my half Mexican fiancee who looks more Latino than anything, but he didn't answer. Now, I've been mistaken for other nationalities, but only other Asian ones. Fortunately I hadn't forgotten all of my 4 years of AP Spanish that I took 10 years ago and I was able to converse with him. He was super nice and very attentive, as was the woman who had taken our order.

We shared an order of 4 taquitos with carnitas ($3.90), the Noel's special torta with carne asada ($3.50), and two carne asada tacos ($1.70 each). I thought it was a good amount of food, and $13 for a dinner for two is a great deal. The taquitos weren't my favorite though - they came as taco shells that were deep fried along with the meat inside, so the carnitas were a bit too dry and crispy for me. The torta was a large sandwich cut in two and the meat inside was very tasty. The tacos were good, and if I was more hungry, I could have probably eaten a few more because they were small. 

There are lots of better taquerias around, but if you happen to be in Bernal, check this place out. Service is great and I don't find that much at other taquerias. Afterwards, you can have ice cream at Maggie Mudd down the street!
author: Connie C.

description: I can't give it 5 starts because I only have tried two items but those two items were AMAZING! I am a mexican from the caribbean so I know a thing about tacos and sea food and they have the BEST SHIRMP tacos in the world! I swear to baby jesus, grilled to perfection with onions and bell peppers and they also put this creamy green cilantro sauce on top with lime, good lord I could have 10 of them. and they are not bad in price either 3.50 is a normal price for shrimp taco, but this is NOT a normal shrimp taco is better. ok im done here im hungry now.
author: Vanderbird V.

description:
Dear lord baby Jesus,

Give me a taqueria that has veggie burritos with fresh grilled vegetables that include broccoli, red and yellow and green peppers, carrots, tomatoes, and lettuce. Mix them with black beans, rice, and the perfect ratio of guacamole, sour cream, and cheese.  Wrap it all up in delicious flour tortilla and lets call it day.

"Child yo wish is granted"

Welcome to Tacos Los Altos.  I have had probably a dozen super veggie burritos across the great land of SF and frankly this is the best place I have found.  The ingredients are so fresh and the ladies working the counter are so sweet.  It just makes my day.

One may wonder, "How the heck does it get an better?"  For those bawlerz on a budget, you can get the same delicious burrito, but as a "baby" and save a buck or so!!!  Super baby veggies burrito please. :)

So thank you lord for Taco Los Altos!
author: Becky T.

description:
OK, I've been back about a dozen times in the last couple weeks for the el pastor tacos (reg, not super) and the ceviche tostada, somes dragging friends who have all ended up going back on their own. My favorite taco in the city hands down, covered in taco goo. 

Still haven't tried anything other the the el pastor or the ceviche.  Perhaps the rest is mediocre, but until I tire of those two, which may take a while, I'm not going to find out.
--------------------
I have to say that I loooove the el pastor tacos.  Also super friendly serice.  We stopped in after a long afternoon at Wild Side West and ordered half a dozen to go and they even threw in a sea food taco which we found when we got home.  Always nice to find extra snacks in your order!
author: Cosmolicious L.

description:
Taco los Altos has the benefit of being close to my office. 

When we have deadlines, we love to pick up burritos for our crew. I always order the regular veggie burrito. Their veggie burrito is outstanding with grilled bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, zucchini and avocado salsa. 

When we have a bit more time on our hands, we like to eat in and they are incredibly generous with the chips and salsa. I request the spicy salsa and they also have habanero salsa if you ask. 

I usually get the fish and shrimp tacos when I dine in. Sometimes I mix in an excellent al pastor taco. Who doesn't like grilled pork?
author: Monica L.

description:
My favorite for veggie anything.  I love the fact that all of their vegetarian items actually have delicious grilled vegetables on them.  Like squash, zucchini, broccoli, mushrooms, carrots...  Lots of times when you order vegetarian items at taquerias, you end up getting the meat item without the meat, not really WITH vegetables other than the bare minimum of lettuce and tomato.  
I must say the ceviche tostada as an appetizer is a must have every time I go.  It's always fresh and has the perfect amount of lime for flavor.
Also, the service is great.  And I love the fact that it's family owned and operated and the folks are very friendly.  They recently repainted and every time I go there, there's some new piece of art or decor somewhere, pretty cool.  Chips and salsa are great, too.  They'll sell you a pint or more of the salsa if you want.  
If you're vegetarian, this is your spot!   And, actually, all my meat lovers friends love it, too!
author: Diane C.

description:
Place was empty at 6:30 on Saturday.  Special of the night was Bistec Ranchero, so we had the special and Chile Verde.  

Chips were cold slightly stale.  Salsa was tasteless.  The Bistec plate was pretty large portions of beef.  Flavor was mediocre.  Chile verde was room temperature and didnt taste like the meat stewed with the sauce.  The quality of meat was not great.

Wouldnt eat here again with so many other choices nearby.
author: May M.

description:
As painful as it is to mark this a 1-star review, I can't deny it.

I succumb to going here only when I'm in a wicked rush, since I live 2 blocks away.

The burritos are as sub-par as it gets. Soft (not crisp) tortillas that are barely heated up, weird combinations like "shrimp, cheese, guacamole, grilled onions and mushrooms". Wtf, who makes up these whorish concoctions? You don't have to go to culinary school to realize that shrimp, cheese, and mushrooms don't go together. After all this, they have the audacity to charge you for their chips, which have to be the worst tasting chips in my 21 years of life. If you actually buy the chips, make sure and dip them in the world's most bland salsa verde.

I'll admit I've only had about 4 burritos here, but if a Mexican restaurant can't make a decent burrito, are they really going to do anything else right?

If you get your food to go, you have the privilege of asking for more than 1 pico de gayo salsa every time.

The only good things about this place that I can scrounge up are the facts they take credit cards, and their pico de gayo is actually pretty good, despite the fact they have nothing acceptable to put it on.

I lived in Southern California almost my whole life, so my expectations are pretty high, but I don't think I've ever disliked a Mexican Food restaurant so much in my life.

GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.
author: Zack G.

description:
I've eaten here twice and both times I've been amazed on how tasty everything is. I've had the Chicken Tostada and the Mole Poblano Chicken, both were yummy.  Chips and sala are great as are the fruit drinks, I had honeydew, fantastic!

I love the atmosphere as well it's somewhere in between a taqueria and a regular sit down restaurant, totally laid back but not a dump either, just nice and comfy. The service is friendly, five starts there!

I will be back whenever I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Adrian H.

description:
beware - !

i just got home from a grueling 12 hours at general hospital on a morphine drip for the stomach cramping and pain, which was a 24 hour ordeal in total.  the anti nausea meds they gave me (the kind they use on cancer patients after chemo didn't make a difference in the recurring relentless waves of dry heaves)  i was going to wait out these symptoms at home but after i vomited blood i though it justified a trip to the ER.  

on saturday afternoon i had, at that point, had nothing to eat all day.  in fact, the last meal i had was the previous night at about 10 pm.  i ordered the carnitas burrito at about 3pm.  i went home and finished the project i had been working on...at about midnight i tried to go to bed but couldn't because of the cramping.  i endured this for the next 20 hours and then had to go to the ER - it just wasnt letting up and seemd to be getting worse.

i'm writing this review primarily because of my experience going into the restaurant today to talk with them about getting sick.  i went in a discreetly told the young lady behind the counter that i was a chef myself, and i know these things happen, but i wanted them to know so that they don't end up killing someone.  i told her about my carnitas burrito and my trip to the ER.  

her response was unbelievable! - she was totally unsympathetic - she actually said it didn't matter at this point becuase they already switched out the carnitas from saturday. (!!)  i said first of all i'm a chef myself and if you had "bad carnitas" it wont matter that you switched it out if the handling practice that got it there in the frist place isn't changed.  And in case you think i'm full of it - i showed her my hospital wrist band which i hadn't removed yet - 

she shrugged her shoulders.  

i felt my blood pressure raised and chose to walk away from it.   unbelievable!  the most horrible customer service ever to accompany 24 hours of horrifying pain.

never again
author: taylor p.

description: Good, honest, Mexican food at great prices. Friendly staff. Small, urban neighborhood atmosphere. I like the chile verde, enchiladas, and steak platters for dinner.  Some items come with grilled onions and bell peppers, and crispy mixed veggies, but you probably could get them on the side, too, and skip the beans and rice if you're on a diet like I am. I married into a Chicano family, so I'm often bored with Mexican food. Otherwise, I'd have given it 4 starts.
author: Lotion M.

description:
I went by the other night as I found myslef needing to pass some time and I in the mood for a burrito. 

Service is very good along with the chips and salsa they put on your table while you examine their menu. I also appreciated the fact that this place is clean because I'm kind of a priss when it comes to things like that along with good service.

I ordered a carne asada burrito and unlike some of the other reviews everything was well prepared. Yes, they keep the burrito simple but, that's the way I like it personally. I like to be able to add salsa and hot sauce to fit my taste. There was never a lack of meat in any of my bites which was surprising because I thought it was going to be stuffed with tons of rice and beans but, it turned out to have an equally large amount of meat.

If you were to ask me if I would go back there for lunch or dinner. I would most definitely  give you a resounding "YES".  The food is simple but yet tasty. The restaurant is clean and the service is good by any standards.
author: Mario O.

description:
My favorite neighborhood eatery.  I'm sure I've eaten here over a hundred times.

I could eat here every day.  Love the tacos and burritos and the tortas... the al pastor, the carnitas, the chicken, the veggie.  So far, it's all been excellent.  Chips are really good too.
author: Mark S.

description: Been here a few times. I'm a fan of their burritos and tacos. Had a friend who got the shrimp tacos (which they boast about) and he loved them. Chips and salsa were good and waiting was friendly.
author: Roxy B.

description:
Other taquerias should take a cue from Los Altos and serve mini burritos for kids (called "baby burritos" and, I think, "little amigos" on the menu). My daughter loves them. And, in fact, they're a great size for adults too (I, for one, rarely eat a normal-size burrito in one sitting).

While I prefer other taquerias' burritos for myself, the ones Los Altos make are perfectly fine, and I did thoroughly enjoy their tilapia dish. The atmosphere is nice for such an affordable place, and I'm happy to support my local burrito joint.
author: Bronwyn X.

description:
Pretty bland stuff. The tacos were juicy but not exactly bursting with flavor. I did feel that the food, particular the vegetables, had a really fresh quality to them. The service was very attentive and prompt, and the tortilla chips tasted home made and not store bought. The portion sizes seemed a little on the small side.

I really liked the decor of the restaurant. I used to pass by this place every day on my way home, and was always curious what it was like. The inside looks much, much different than the outside. It's very bright and cheery and clean looking. I would probably give this place another shot, just because I liked the service and the atmosphere, and the prices were decent.
author: Trish B.

description:
OK, all props to Cait Z., who knows the value of proximity in making a review. Because, basically, if you live in Bernal Heights, your options for immediately-obtainable, good, cheap food are limited. There are a lot of hungry people in Bernal Heights and they are clamoring for a good, easy place to grab a bite after the work day is done. But, if you really care about the tastiness of your food, Bernal is going to make it hard for you to get something satisfying. 

Taco Los Altos is ok. Cait had it right: their shrimp tacos do actually kick some sort of portion of an ass. But otherwise, what you're looking at is a restaurant with very sympathetic service where they treat you like a king, but where they offer pretty mediocre food.

Their food kind of sucks. I have tried all kinds of ways of ordering to make this better, but when it comes down to it, the tacos are only ok, and the burritos do really suck. The meat is either too dry and salty (carnitas), or bland and ill-cooked (pollo asado) or just craptastically ill-cooked (lengua, al pastor, carne asada (!!)) Their carne asada is both watery and greasy. Plus, their prices are totally Bernal post-gentrification: you could easily pay $8 for a super burrito. And it would still kinda suck.

At they same time, they are lovely people. and I want to love them. But at the other same time, captive market.
author: deathstar j.

description:
There are 3 separate entrances to this place, but only the one in the middle will get you inside.  Take a seat and someone will bring you a menu.  The staff are pleasant and won't rush you.

The super burrito with carnitas went down well.  It had great flavor and even a hint of sweetness in it.  I'm not sure what that was from.  A little heavy on the rice, but all in all it was tasty.  I left stuffed and I'll eat there again when on Cortland.
author: Rob U.

description: Authentic consistant cheap and fresh - the veggie tacos are awesome!! I have been eating them regularly for almost 3 years!
author: Summer H.

description: Stumbled down the block from Wild Side West for a buffer for the drinks and was served up just right.  Service may be a little slow...but it's south-of-the-border pace.  What's your rush? I wasn't into a 5 lb torta like the others - which they raved about - so one taco el pastor was fine.  The waitress suggested to top it off with a sauce and chopped pineapple.  Maybe I was drunk...I don't do pineapple on pizza, even, but I couldn't argue...it was tasty!  I'll be back...
author: Doug V.

description:
i work close to Los Altos. And while the Mexican fare in Bernal Heights is a bit on the lackluster side, Los Altos is passable. i tried their fish tacos (so-so), taquitos (excellent!), tostada (alright). 

the horchata is definitely a highlight but the prices are .. uh... not really. but then again, it's bernal heights and they are the only taqueria around so I understand....
author: ray e.

description: Not bad for a burrito fix, especially when you're in Bernal Heights and too lazy to grab one in the Mission. The burritos are smaller than what I'm used to in the Mission, but they're also cheaper by a couple quarters. Food is average, but there's something in it that leaves a weird aftertaste in my mouth.
author: Zell C.

description:
I've been back a few times for their veggie burritos, and I've always found them to have a great mix of fresh veggies and spices. I remember last time I was praising the perfect spice mixture and veggies, it was that good. It's not just a plain, boring burrito - it has an interesting flavor to it , and they really stuff it with healthy veggies.

Today I didn't want too much because I was planning on going to Maggie Mudd afterwards (well, I'm always planning that, but I didn't want to be overstuffed today like usual). I got two regular veggie tacos and a side of guacamole. I was a little disappointed with the tacos - they were very bland - so I'll be sticking with the burrito from now on.

Also, everyone there is really nice, but eating in a few times they always seem to forget to bring me the check. I'm always sitting there wondering if I'm supposed to go up to pay, but then I see other people get their checks and I just sit and sit and sit with my empty plate wondering what to do. It wasn't even busy. Today I just finally went up to the counter and paid, so if they forget about you for a little while, even if they're giving other people their checks, don't waste your time. Your order will be up at the front and you can put your tip in the jar.

I was leaning toward giving them three stars, but remembering the tasty burrito bumped it up to four.
author: Amy R.

description:
We recently took my Sister-in-law, her husband and our two nieces here and the service could not have been more friendly and attentive. The food was delish and came out pretty fast for a party of six. They totally went out of their way for our nieces which was much appreciated.
Plus SB and his sis are from So. Cal and think the Mexican food up here isn't nearly as good, but SIL *loved* it.
author: Catty C.

description: You got to try the grilled fish tacos and ceviche tostadas. Super tasty. Always satisfying.
author: nis y.

description:
I don't really understand how this place is considered cheap.  They are much more expensive than La Corneta Taqueria in nearby Glen Park.  At La Corneta, I get a huge veggie burrito with chips for under $5 and the super veggie with chips at Los Altos somehow always comes closer to $8 (I know the menu says it costs $6, but trust me, it will ring up closer to $8).  

I've come to think of Tacos Los Altos as Cortland Mexican - a slightly more gourmet, upper-middle-class-American tacqueria choice.  This is a tacqueria that doesn't seem out of place with the Liberty Cafe and its wine bar just down the street.  

They include an appealing assortment of grilled veggies in their vegetarian dishes (yes, that means you will find broccoli, zucchini and carrots in your super veggie burrito - not bad at all, but also not really what I typically want when I have a burrito craving).  That said,  if you are after a freaking gigantic veggie Tostada that will water your mouth or a sky-high order of impressive-looking veggie nachos, then Tacos Los Altos is definitely worth a try.  If memory serves, their salsa is also particularly good.  

They are quite kid-friendly.  If you dine in, there is even waitress service.  When I ate there with a friend, the waitress gave us suggestions and was very congenial. She was strangely pleased by my friend's decision to order regular Coke and somewhat saddened when I ordered Diet Coke.  I felt bad.  

Most days of the week, I'd go to Corneta in Glen Park instead, but if I feel like fancy Mexican, if I'm out with a friend, or if I simply want to delude myself into thinking that broccoli, carrots, zucchini, and mushrooms will cancel out cheese and chips, Tacos Los Altos can count on my 8 bucks.
author: Ann S.

description: What stand out the most are the Noel's Special Torta (best in al pastor) and their shrimp and fish tacos! Really flavorful and all the meat is super tender. Their Sangria is the best I've had thus far--refreshing but not watered down. I go here at least once a week :)
author: Adlyn S.

description: Anyone who gives this place more than one star is completely out of their mind. Tacos Los Altos served us some of the worst Mexican food I have ever eaten, and I am not a picky eater. The ice tea was so weak it might as well have been water. The coffee was lukewarm and had an intended hint of cinnamon. The grilled steak enchiladas tasted as if the beef had been marinated with a musty dishrag. The beans definitely came from a can. The guacamole was so old and oxidized it was brown. I had two bites of my dish and pushed it aside. When we stopped by a bakery down the street afterward and were complaining about the food at Tacos Los Altos, the cashier told us her boss got food poisoning there. Do not eat at Tacos Los Altos, just a horrible place.
author: Jay D.

description:
This hole in the wall has excellent super fish and super chicken tacos and apparently (because it was displayed) they got a 100% on their health code inspection recently. 

Congrats Tacos Los Altos. 

I'll go back.
author: martin l.

description: The food is really good and inexpensive.  The sangria was tasty as well. I recommend the steak fajitas and the shrimp dinner plate.  The chips and salsa were fresh which is a big plus.
author: H. A.

description:
I have had a lot of bad experiences here and would give it 1 star, but my wife likes it and it seems like the majority of the ingredients are made from scratch... 

I'd also like to point out that a lot of the other reviews I've read seem to be mostly favorable write-ups of Mexican food. Yes, Mexican food is good, but this isn't it.

Admittedly, I have not tried all of their food. I do not eat meat, which is 90% of their menu, but I can get along anywhere in Mexico... They have a vegetable mixture that can be included in the standard taco, burrito experience but, it's not very good.  And WATERY as all get out. My plate is filled with water after a burrito.

They charge premium prices for their food (think Papalote), and the cuisine is not imaginative (as similarly priced competitors).

I'm sure it would be better if you eat intestines, menudo and the like. I asked for their hot salsa on my burrito last time and it was so hot I got a horrible stomach ache and had trouble breathing, and I love hot food. 

I doubt I will never go there again, they would have to radically change their menu.
author: Freud R.

description:
Best Burritos on Cortland!

Ok, that's not saying much, as they are pretty much the only burrito place on Cortland. But still, very good stuff, especially the shrimp or fish variety (hold the mushrooms, thank you). My wife loves the veggie stuff, which as others have noted includes a huge variety of vegetables you don't ordinarily see in taqueria food. Good tacos, flautas, fajitas. Very friendly staff. I'd probably come here all the time even if it weren't a block and a half away.
author: Mike S.

description: For "el Cinco de Mayo", I was quite pleased that the "Taco guy" would be returning to cater a work function.  I think I ate something like 5 tacos for lunch on Tuesday.  The steak, chicken, pork, and vegetable tacos with light corn tortillas and a myriad of salsa choices were just that delicious.  The beans and rice were also good but there was something special about the freshly prepared seasoned meat.  Noel (the owner of Taco Los Altos) was friendly and professional and reasonably priced for catering.  Hence this was the third time he was invited back and I made a point to ask for his information for my 150th review.  If I am ever in Bernal Heights in San Francisco, I will gladly try the actual restaurant.
author: Anne K.

description:
Let me preface this review by stating that I am an aficionado of Mexican food- the real stuff in Mexico, and the gringo-ized stuff we have in some cases in the US. I also know my new mexi food as well as tex-mex.

This place is just ok- however, I will say this, order what the restaurants specializes in. in this case I believe it would be the fish tacos--- of which, I did not order. I broke my cardinal rule and I got burned.

I ordered a regular burrito with carnitas. 

I asked for salsa as I could not taste any on the burrito.
The burrito was pretty much lacking in flavor- the carnitas was on the border of being tasteless. Oh, I also added salt.

I was charged .75 for the little tub of salsa which should have been on the damn burrito in the first place. I was not charged for the salt.

I am tempted to go back and try the special- 

I may...but seeing that I was charged .75 for fairly crappy salsa, probably not--- 

Bamn- off the list.
author: Mona R.

description:
This place stands out for it's seafood tacos and aqua fresca.  I had a ceviche tostada... Oh man, it was better than any I'd had in Mexico.  Limey and fresh and delicious.  I tried to hide my enjoyment so my husband wouldn't be tempted to steal the last few bites.  But alas, my mmms slipped out and I had to concede.
