The sandia agua fresca was fresh and did not taste like it had any sugar.  Just watermelony goodness.  

The staff was very nice and the place just has a good friendly divey feel.  I'd walk here from the Mission just to get the ceviche.
author: senna c.

description:
My wife took me here because she said that they had fantastic vegetarian burritos for cheap. I ended up getting the fish burrito (for cheap) and it was awesome. 

I can go to approximately 9.12 billion restaurants in the bay area and order an overpriced mahi mahi taco if I want to feel wretched, but at Tacos Los Altos, I can get a burrito made with fresh grilled fish for seven bucks. Fish, guac, mushrooms, onions, black beans, it just melts in my mouth. Lordie, it's good.

Also, I think the salsa has ... sage ... in it? I don't know if that is a plus or a minus, but the salsa is deep.

Also, the staff are super friendly.
author: Taters M.

description:
First, let me say that I believe the basic elements of a burrito to include beans, rice, pico de gallo, and /some other filling./   Traditionally, the other filling is meat.  This, of course, causes a dilemma for people who do not eat meat.  What should the put in their burrito instead of meat?  VEGETABLES!

Sadly, most places in San Francisco, even places that tout their skills at making a vegetarian burrito, do not replace the meat with vegetables.  They simply remove the meat from the burrito equation, leaving it unbalanced and incomplete.

Tacos Los Altos knows how to do the math.  Their vegetarian burritos are filled with delicious spiced, roasted vegetables.  The mixture varies - sometimes is broccoli-heavy, sometimes it zucchini-heavy, sometimes there are a lot of carrots.  But my god, delicious.

I also humbly submit that they have the best chips in the city.  Crispy! Not crunchy.  Not crackly.  Crispy!

Finally, Tacos Los Altos makes their own extremely spicy hot sauce.  I believe it has habeneros in it. Like a fire made of awesome in your gullet.
author: Ben B.

description: I had a pork burrito with sauce on it.  It tasted like the ingredients were a month old.  Very lackluster and bland. Kind of sad, because I like the neighborhood.  Strange, too because usually Mexican food is good in this city.  Although, as soon as you get out of the Mission, it all goes downhill.
author: Mitch A.

description: The food here is awsome!! Very fresh and made to order. I love the Chili Verde Pork. The people working there are also very friendly.
author: Frankie V.

description:
I'd prefer a Gordo over Tacos Los Altos anytime, though I am not roaming around the Sunset and/or Richmond districts. 

Although I've only patronized this little Bernal Heights Mexican food-joint once, I'd say that their burritos are a tad too bland (as in lacking in flavor). 
On the plus side, a baby burrito easily filled my hungry stomach up (and not to mention cheap!). 

Quick service, no gimmicks whatsoever. 

One annoying pest ruined my time at Tacos Los Altos thanks to the continual bawling of a baby situated behind me. 

Complementary dish of homemade chips and salsa lands in front of your table before ordering. :)
author: Court L.

description:
Five stars for you, Tacos los Altos.  

You are so great, especially for your tacos.  Your tacos are rad.

Although the super taco is really generous with ingredients, I prefer the regular.  The basic is such a lovely meal and usually I have two, but sometimes three is just right.  

All the meats I've tried so far have been excellent, but the Tinga is to die for.  It's so spicy and smokey and I love it.
author: Gramme F.

description:
Bernal Heights tosses it's hat into the burrito ring, and the result is a pretty good one from Los Altos. Not a big fan of the quarter surcharge for a wheat tortilla, but when you stuff it with seemingly healthy BBQ chicken and black beans, you get a fourth star.

Anyone into chips (I'm not), beware more surcharges if you want some.
author: Jason B.

description:
I love this place. It's really all about the veggie burrito for me. The vegetables are fresh and grilled to perfection. I have not tried their other fare, but highly recommended for vegetarians or those looking for a healthier burrito. 

The staff is very friendly too.
author: Dawn M.

description: There are days I need to eat something fast and not too expensive, but hate to descend the hill. Often I end up getting the carnitas burrito here. Sometimes it's passable, sometimes it just doesn't taste so fresh. once or twice I've ended up with a post-burrito stomachache. This is one of the few cheap lunch places on Cortland, so perhaps it's the lack of competition that is to blame for the mediocrity. Staff is friendly tho.
author: leila N.

description:
The wife and I go and split the parillada para dos - basically mixed grill fajitas - with chicken, steak, shrimp, and chorizo. While the food isn't award winning, it's solid and more than satisfies our craving for Mexican food in a sit-down, low-key environment. 

Family owned joint w/super nice service adds a star.
author: Carmine D.

description:
Not my favorite taqueria in the city, but it's my local one and it's pretty good.  I stick with the tacos or the asada dinner plate when I go.  They veggie tacos are not to be missed, and ask for the habanero sauce if you like spicy.

The staff are super friendly and helpful.  We had a visitor once who can't eat gluten, and the hostess brought out the packages of all the food they cook so we could check the ingredients lists.
author: Jimmy C.

description: I love this place.  The tacos and fresh green salsa are awesome.  The atmosphere is pretty boring, but it's all about the tacos.  And the habanero salsa.  OK i'm going over there right now...
author: Ryan T.

description: Any place that serves Modelo Dark and Light is in my good books. My favorite item on the menu is the vegetarian burrito. Real vegetables like broccoli and carrots are always in there.  My friend ordered the Lingua and she dug that too. My other friend had the seafood tostado and was also happy.
author: Kelly S.

description: 3.5 stars. You know when something tastes home-made/home-cooked? That's what this place feels like. Nothing fancy. Just good food. I like that. Great chips and salsa to start. They just started making a hotter/heatier salsa. Yum! I always order the tacos, open faced veggie tacos. Tastes great! You can order two tacos for about 5 bucks! They also have good specials. My husband is more adventureous than I am, and tries their specials, and enjoys them. They also have pretty good sangria. For the price, homie feel and the friendly staff, this place is great.
author: Caroline C.

description:
good tasting salsa. the super burrito carnitas on whole wheat was very flavorsome and that was minus the beans and rice. the mole poblano was also good-tasting and mouthwatering, the chicken was supple, salad was fresh and the beans was ok. however, the carnitas was on the dry side, though tasty and the mole sauce wasn't cooked together with the chicken, making it looked very thick, just like it came out from a can or bottle, but it was surprisingly palatable.
the lady who seated and served us was very warm and welcoming. in addition, place has a simple decor and very clean.
author: Nelle A.

description: Their burritos are sub-par. Vegetarian burritos should consist of guacamole, beans, rice, salsa, cheese, and sour cream. Theirs has corn and carrots in them (which I am all for in non-burrito land) and aren't tasty at all. Stick with the quesadilla if you have to eat here. It's hard to mess up tortillas and cheese.
author: Wendy C.

description: we've hired the taco man on several occasions.  for some reason, the tacos being served by taco man tastes way better than the one served at their restaurant.  it's sooo tasty (chicken, carnitas and carne asada).  the price is not bad as well.
author: Kae B.

description: You probably won't write home about the food here, but you will be safely satiated.  The service is always quick and friendly.
author: Jessie S.

description: It took about 30 min. to get our drinks, and took another 15 min. to get our food! It wasn't even that busy. The size of the baby burrito was as big as a regular burrito, that being said it wasn't very good. They messed up my order & the rice & beans were ice cold. Took forever to get another order of hot rice & beans. My dish was just alright at best.
author: c w.

description: I want to love this place because it's the nearest mexican place to me, but I keep eating here and not completely satisfied, quesadillas and enchiladas are pretty good, but the burritos, the most important thing, are just not that great, to much rice and beans, and I understand these are fillers, but come on now this is ridiculous.
author: JIll H.

description: I changed my mind. This is my burrito rating. On the advice of a friend I had one and it was good. Mazeltov.
author: Mark G.

description: I do find it strange that this is the only Mexican restaurant in our neighborhood. That being said, I'm really not suffering. I've only gotten two things at Tacos Los Altos (but I've gotten them a lot): the veggie burrito and the fish tacos. Both are extremely delicious. I usually get takeout, 'cause the ambiance... not so cute. But the service is adorable... everyone's always super friendly and sweet. Yay Bernal!
author: Cary M.

description: We had lunch here because it was a beautiful day out and they had outside tables in the sun. The food was unfortunately mediocre. We had the super tacos and they were bland and tasteless. Thank god for the "spicy" salsa to drench out tacos to give it some taste. But even the "spicy" salsa was pretty tame. I wish this place was better.  It doesn't take that much effort to make mexican with some flavor and spice.
author: Mike A.

description: The vegetarian burritos are real good.  Love the grilled vegies.  And they're great about getting your order right (no green peppers please).  So if you want a vegie burrito without the extra vegies, just ask.  The salsa is also very good.
author: Wan T.

description: Great lunch here. Loved the super veggie burrito. Friendly service and reasonably priced.
author: Scott C.

description: I just moved into the neighborhood...figured I had to check out the local taqueria to see if Bernal is a legit neighborhood.  Only had time for a quick bite.  Normally would have opted for the burrito, but something made me order a Torta (mexican sandwich)...man was that a great idea.  I got the carne Asada Torta.  Absolutely delicious.  Bread was soft, meat was seasoned perfectly, sauce (avocado?) was amazing.  I still haven't tried the golden standard (burrito), but I can say without hesitation that you won't go wrong with the torta.
author: Dan W.

description: I had two cheap and tasty veggie (soft, open-face) tacos here last Sunday afternoon -- the veggies were fresh and not the usual pile of overcooked onions and peppers you get at other Mexican places. There were carrots, broccoli, and lots of black beans -- very fresh and filling!  Topped with a unique (to me) tomatillo-avocado salsa that I loved. It has a nice family atmosphere and you get a free basket of nachos and salsa to start, too. Friendly, low-key service. If you're strolling around Bernal Heights on a beautiful Sunday afternoon, it's a perfect stop for something (reasonably) healthy  -- or just with some nutritional value -- before gorging yourself on treats at Maggie Mudd's...
author: Karen W.

description: Ate here last weekend after shopping at kids consignment shop down the street. What a great find!  Wife and I loved the food.  Only complaint is that the hot sauce wasn't really hot but if that is the only complaint, then you known they have a good thing going.
author: Matthew S.

description: Tasty, reasonably priced, neighborhood place. The woman who is usually working when I go here has the sweetest smile.  The baby burritos are great.  The veggie taco with a home made tortilla is awesome.
author: Jen R.

description: Great food, friendly service and a nice selection on the menu. I love going here with family and friends. It's not the absolute best Mexican food in the city, but it's an awesome family, neighborhood restaurant. Yum!
author: Seth B.

description: yummy food, one of the only hole-in-the-wall Mexican resturants that serve flautas! I LOVE IT! Horchata, yum! Strawberry drinks, yum! Burritos, YUMM! Rice places, YUMMMMMMM! You can always tell a place is good if the construction workers and police officers go there.
author: Kelly Marie C.

description: My regular takeout order here is the shrimp tacos.  Lots of mushrooms and green peppers, with a great guacamole sauce.  Prices are ok -- nothing else I've tried has stood out.  The fish ceviche is reasonable as well, but nothing as good as Playa Azul down Cortland on Mission.  Staff are always pleasant and friendly.
author: Dave S.

description:
i only loved the friendly staff.  food was mediocre - filling/fresh but not satisfying.  in a city with so much mexican food, it's good to be discerning.  

eat elsewhere.
author: Kris P.

description: I've eaten here a few times. The mojado burritos are good, and the owners and employees are friendly. The burritos are SOLID, like a paper weight. It's good they don't skimp on the meat, but it was almost imbalanced. Overall, a very nice addition to Cortland St.
author: Nick S.

description: ok.  the service was a bit sketchy and the place is a little um...sticky.  but i was totally and pleasantly surprised to have one of the best veggie burritos of my life here last weekend.  they stuff their delicious tortillas full of beans, rice and a wide variety of perfectly grilled veggies.  it is pretty unbelievable.  the taco was great too but the grilled veggie super burrito is totally where it's at!  not the cheapest place but you're on cortland street so it could be much worse.  and the salsa was incredible.  totally fresh and chock full of cilantro.  yum.  dessert at maggie mudd's and it's the perfect lunch.
author: kate s.

description: I really want to give this place a good rating because they are so, so nice, but to be honest, the food is completely sub-standard.  Being at the end of the Mission, with some of the best Mexican food available in the city, I am not sure how this is even possible.   And I have even given them three chances - but the dish I most recently had - carnitas that tasted like boiled pork without any seasoning whatsoever - had to be some of the worst anywhere.  They must only get business due to the location - the only Mexican restaurant on the Hill.  But, again, they're really nice.  That's the one star.  Otherwise they'd get zero.
author: Heather F.

description: Great little neighborhood eating place. They made the best fish taco's I've ever had.
author: Juanita P.

description:
One of the better Mexican restaurants that I've been to lately. This first thing you notice is the really friendly service.

I had grilled fish tacos, which were fresh and really good. The salsa here is really good too.
author: a a.

description: Not only because it's in my 'hood, but I really like the food at Los Altos. I stick to the pozole and the chile verde, 'cuz that's my favorites here. I'm never disappointed. Generous portions and just as traditional as I've had in Mexico.
author: Eric U.

description: This is one of my favorite Mexican places in the city. I give it 5 stars not because it's fancy or upscale but because they are good at what they do. They have great food, nice staff, reasonable prices and it's clean. My favorites are their veggie & shrimp tacos. They put an avocado salsa on the shrimp tacos that is awesome. Their fajitas were good too. I stole a bite of my husband's and plan to get it next time. Yum!
author: Jen S.

description: Went for the first and only time this past weekend. With all the great taquerias of SF a stone's throw away, I don't know why you'd go here. Burritos were soggy and bland. I tossed the second half of mine rather than waste valuable stomach space on it.
author: Evan D.

description: Both my girlfriend and I had wicked diarrhea after eating here!  We both had two regular tacos.  It was either the salsa and/or guacamole.  Nice enough people, good service.  Food tasted okay, but then two hours later, it all came screaming out of our arses.  When I eat at a restaurant, I expect the food to be fresh and edible.  Clearly their food is not fresh.  It was our first time there, and will now be our last.  I recommend you stay away too.
author: Customer X.

description:
Best tacos ever.. I'm not sure what their magic ingredient is but I must say every taco I have had here has been awesome. Also I like the fact that they have the concept of a baby burrito as I am never able to finish a regular size burrito.

All is all very friendly and welcoming staff and awesome food.
author: amruta m.

description:
Great food at reasonable prices.  Every time we go, someone tries something new, and we are never disappointed.  Looking forward to the soups in the winter.  Friendly staff help when you have questions.

Love the sangria, and they've just started serving low-voltage (wine-based?) margaritas that are perfect with fish tacos, well honestty, with most everything.  

AND, this place earned a perfect score from the CIty of SF in the restaurant cleanliness ratings.  Good food and clean?  The best!
author: SF G.

description:
it's hit or miss at taqueria los altos. 
tho, I always LOVE the chilaquiles with a couple of fried eggs added.
much different than other chilaquiles, they're strangely, in a bland sort of way, delicious.
author: M V.

description: When I first moved to Bernal, I was a little unsure of this place.  But then I went inside with a friend once and noticed they had a "100" score card from the health department. That's a good sign.  So, I quizzed them about their ingredients like only a suspicious vegan can do (I try not to sound too crazy when I do this -- thing is, I have to know this stuff to be able to eat there, but I'm always sorry to be a pain and try to be as polite as possible).  Got the all clear on the goods that make up the veggie burrito and veggie taco and the guacamole.  Later I decided to give it a try and was really happy I did -- the veggies are really fresh and delicious, the food/chips are not too salty, the portion sized not too small, not too big.  Now I eat here often and like it a lot!  The ONLY thing I'd change is from conventional to organic ingredients.  Then I would readily give them 5 full stars.  The owners are really nice and they serve their food with a smile.  I love going here and it's one of our regular places to eat now.  I've gone here with meat eating friends and they have not been all that impressed -- but I have to say that the veggie burrito and veggie tacos (yum, lime guacamole salsa) and their chipotle hot salsa are all really excellent.
author: Kasie M.

description: my mouth is watering as I'm writing this review .. they give you HUGE portions of some of the yummiest mexican faire I've had in days .. thank you so very much Tacos Los Altos!! And why yes you are tops to me!
author: Jill W.

description: the people here are always incredibly nice and while i can only speak to their vegetarian options - their super veggie burrito is one of my favorites in town (it's full of fresh grilled veggies).
author: nicole a.

description: The Guacamole is bland, watery and there is too much lemon juice in it.  I asked if it was out of a can because it was not very good.  I had the burrito mojado and it was somewhat better.   There are so many other Mexican restaurants to choose from why go here?  I won't be back.  BTW: after telling the waitress that the guacamole was not good and leaving most of it on the plate, we were charged for it!
author: John V.

description: i go here because it's walking distance from my house, and it fills the role of "vendor who will provide mexican food to feed my stomach."  if El Metate were closer i'd never go here again.  it sucks saying that since they're such nice folks, but the food just has this "soggy" feel to it.  the grilled veggie burrito could be awesome if they cut up the veggies into smaller pieces.
author: Senor P.

description: Tacos Los Altos did an excellent job catering for my  50 + guest birthday party.  Hobart (robert ?) was organized, on time, jovial and did a great job of serving up the soft tacos and quesidillas.  It was a big hit at the party!  Janet helped coordinate what to serve and her sister and staff at the restaurant were all helpful.  Great quesidillas and tacos!  Chips and a variety of salsas.  The price was right and I couldn't be happier with the amount of food (I was a little nervous about having enough for the party but Janet reassured me and she was right).  If you want fresh grilled al pastor pork, chicken or shrimp tacos for your party, call Los Altos Tacos. I am very satisfied.
author: lola s.

description: I might be spoiled with so many amazing taquerias in this city, but this was the worst super chicken burrito I've ever had in my life. It was bland and unappetizing, like eating chewy water. The salsa that came with the greasy chips was also watery and tasteless. I can't afford to throw away any food so to try and salvage my meal I asked for some hot sauce and had to douse each bite just to get my taste buds activated. I will not be going here again.
author: Emily G.

description: Friendly local place.  Love their Mojado Burritos.  Mmmm...
author: Chris F.

description: This place keeps getting better and better over time. Stick with the tacos, burritos, and fajitas. Avoid the carne as it is dry and tasteless (another reviewer mentioned this.) I love getting a super shrimp burrito. Also, this is the only joint in the city which actually puts roasted veggies in its burritos- mmmm, muy bueno.
author: Mike K.
